text: Hinchey Announces $3.6 Million in Economic Recovery Funding For Local Housing Authorities
label: HH1

text: Tuesday, 24 March 2009 19:00
label: BODY

text: Washington, DC - Congressman Maurice Hinchey (D-NY) today announced that the
label: BODY

text: Binghamton, Ithaca, Kingston, Newburgh, Poughkeepsie, Monticello, and Woodridge Housing
label: BODY

text: Authorities will receive a total of $1.65 million in federal funds from the recently-approved
label: BODY

text: economic recovery bill. The funds, which Hinchey voted for, will be used to pay for a variety of
label: BODY

text: public housing projects that have been delayed due to a lack of funding. The Kingston Housing
label: BODY

text: Authority will receive $281,757 from the economic recovery package; the Housing Authority of
label: BODY

text: Newburgh will receive $224,341; the Binghamton Housing Authority will receive $1,308,424; the
label: BODY

text: Ithaca Housing Authority will receive $649,230; the Poughkeepsie Housing Authority will receive
label: BODY

text: $869,736; the Monticello Housing Authority will receive $193,712; and the Woodridge Housing
label: BODY

text: Authority will receive $81,855.
label: BODY

text: "These federal funds will help make improvements to local public housing units that have been
label: BODY

text: needed for some time, but have lacked the necessary federal funding," Hinchey said. "This
label: BODY

text: economic recovery funding nearly doubles the amount of federal support given to local housing
label: BODY

text: authorities on an annual basis. These improvements and modernizations will help improve the
label: BODY

text: lives of the residents and the quality of public housing abroad."
label: BODY

text: Allocated through an established formula, this funding will allow local housing agencies to
label: BODY

text: address long-standing improvement needs to public housing units. It will also help to create jobs
label: BODY

text: in the area and increase energy efficiency within public housing units. HUD's Capital Fund
label: BODY

text: Program provides annual funding to public housing authorities to develop, finance, and
label: BODY

text: modernize the public housing in their communities. This funding can also be used to make
label: BODY

text: large-scale improvements such as new roofs; and for the replacement of plumbing and
label: BODY

text: electrical systems to more energy efficient standards.
label: BODY

text: In addition to the funds announced today, the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban
label: BODY

text: Development (HUD) will soon make an additional $1 billion available nationwide through a
label: BODY

text: competitive grant process.
label: BODY
